intro: Thryptomene dielsiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thryptomene, is a shrub native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Thryptomene dielsiana is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and heathland environments.
